content: Can you describe the texture of sandpaper?

Sandpaper has a rough texture due to the abrasive particles embedded on its surface. These particles are usually made of materials like aluminum oxide, silicon carbide, or garnet, depending on the grade and intended use of the sandpaper. The roughness can vary from fine to coarse, with finer grades having smaller particles and a less rough feel, while coarser grades have larger particles and a more aggressive texture.
